result.execSummary:
The defendant Elizabeth A Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges

miscConds.notes: Restitution for Target to be paid as a condition of probation before costs or fines.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended. Continue to comply with current treatment and sign releases for agent.

No Contact with the Target store in New Berlin. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
May terminate probation after 6 months if deemed appropriate by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Elizabeth A Smith in court with Attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts #1 & 2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #1 & 2.  Counts #3 & 4 are dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Bricco makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE:   

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR          **CONCURRENT**   *May terminate after 6 months, if deemed appropriate by agent*

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Continue to comply with current treatment and sign releases
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Target in New Berlin

RESTITUTION:  $1,179.98 to Target (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $253.00  (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  20 Days, Straight time - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion


COUNT #2:  WITHHELD SENTENCE:   

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR          **CONCURRENT**   *May terminate after 6 months, if deemed appropriate by agent*

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Continue to comply with current treatment and sign releases
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Target in New Berlin

COSTS:  $243.00  (to be paid as a condition of probation)
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/Target Store listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Elizabeth A Smith in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 09:30 am.
